help.text: An issue was discovered in pip (all versions) because it installs the version with the highest version number, even if the user had intended to obtain a private package from a private index. This only affects use of the '--extra-index-url' option, and exploitation requires that the package does not already exist in the public index (and thus the attacker can put the package there with an arbitrary version number).
help.markdown:
CVE-2018-20225 found in package pip

**Severity**: Medium
**CVSSv3 Score**: 7.8
**Image**: securethecloud/my-tweet-app-lacework:latest
**Image layer hash**: sha256:36978e00d4f2a969790ef724c9cf353cdb3afee25fe5cd40d20b1784fa285127
**Image creation command**: RUN pip install --upgrade pip # buildkit
**Package Name**: pip@20.3.4

#### Description
An issue was discovered in pip (all versions) because it installs the version with the highest version number, even if the user had intended to obtain a private package from a private index. This only affects use of the '--extra-index-url' option, and exploitation requires that the package does not already exist in the public index (and thus the attacker can put the package there with an arbitrary version number).

More details [here](https://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvename.cgi?name=CVE-2018-20225).

help.text: Denial of Service due to unexpected memory usage in the Pallets Project Flask
